definition: for the sake of, because of
certainly, surely, of course; at least
to believe, trust [+ dat. of person believed; + acc. of thing believed)
to teach (often with 2 accusatives: one of the person, the other of the thing taught)
to need, lack [+ gen. or abl.]
to carry, bear, endure; report, say
to become, be made, be done
to cause to flee, put to flight
so, thus, in such a way
it is allowed, may [+ dative and infinitive]

headword: locus, locī, m. ( also n. in pl.)
nē ullus, nē ulla, nē ullum

definition: to not know, to be ignorant (of)
it is right, ought to [+ acc. and infinitive]
it repents; sorry [+ acc. of person and gen. of thing]
to go back, come back, return
to fear, be afraid of [+ acc.]
